books.title: How Beautiful We Were
books.author: Imbolo Mbue
books.description: From the celebrated author of the New York Times bestseller Behold the Dreamers, comes a sweeping, wrenching story about the collision of a small African village and an America oil company.

books.title: The Plot
books.author: Jean Hanff Korelitz
books.description: Hailed as breathtakingly suspenseful, Jean Hanff Korelitz's The Plot is a propulsive read about a story too good not to steal, and the writer who steals it.

books.title: Ariadne
books.author: Jennifer Saint
books.description: In a world where women are nothing more than the pawns of powerful men, will Ariadne's decision to betray Crete for Theseus ensure her happy ending? Or will she find herself sacrificed for her lover's ambition?

books.title: The Other Black Girl
books.author: Zakiya Dalila Harris
books.description: Get Out meets The Stepford Wives in this electric debut about the tension that unfurls when two young Black women meet against the starkly white backdrop of New York City book publishing.

books.title: The Four Winds
books.author: Kristin Hannah
books.description: A powerful American epic about love and heroism and hope, set during the Great Depression, a time when the country was in crisis and at war with itself, when millions were out of work and even the land seemed to have turned against them.

books.title: The Last Thing He Told Me
books.author: Laura Dave
books.description: We all have stories we never tell. Before Owen Michaels disappears, he manages to smuggle a note to his beloved wife of one year: Protect her.

books.title: Unbound: My Story of Liberation and the Birth of the Me Too Movement
books.author: Tarana Burke
books.description: Tarana Burke shares her never before revealed life story of how she first came to say me too and launch one of the largest cultural events in American history.

books.title: The Paper Palace
books.author: Miranda Cowley Heller
books.description: Elle will have to decide between the life she has made with her genuinely beloved husband, Peter, and the life she always imagined she would have had with her childhood love, Jonas, if a tragic event hadn't forever changed the course of their lives.

books.title: The Push
books.author: Ashley Audrain
books.description: A tense, page-turning psychological drama about the making and breaking of a family–and a woman whose experience of motherhood is nothing at all what she hoped for–and everything she feared.

books.title: What's Mine and Yours
books.author: Naima Coster
books.description: ...A sweeping novel of legacy, identity, the American family-and the ways that race affects even our most intimate relationships.
